sen.j: 三角縁神獣鏡（さんかくぶちしんじゅうきょう・さんかくえんしんじゅうきょう）は、銅鏡の形式の一種で、縁部の断面形状が三角形状となった大型神獣鏡。
sen.e: Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror/Sankakuen Shinjukyo Mirror is a kind of the forms of bronze mirror and large mirror engraving divine beasts with triangular-rim in its cross-section.
Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror/Sankakuen Shinjukyo Mirror is a kind of bronze mirror and large mirror engraving divine beasts with a triangular-rim in its cross-section.
Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror/Sankakuen Shinjukyo Mirror is a kind of bronze mirror and large mirror engraving divine beasts with a triangular-rim in its cross-section.

sen.j: 日本の古墳時代前期の古墳から多く発掘され、既に400面以上も検出されている。
sen.e: Many were discovered in the tumulus in the early Japanese Kofun period (tumulus period) and more than 400 were already detected.
Many were discovered in tumulus during the early Japanese Kofun period (tumulus period) and more than 400 have already been detected.
Many were discovered in tumulus during the early Japanese Kofun period (tumulus period) and more than 400 have already been detected.

sen.j: 面径は平均20センチ程度。
sen.e: The diameter is about 20 centimeters long on average.
The diameter is about twenty centimeters on average.
The diameter is about twenty centimeters on average.

sen.j: 鏡背に神獣（神像と霊獣）が鋳出され、中国、魏 (三国)の年号を銘文中に含むものも多くある。
sen.e: The divine beasts (image of a deity and holy animals) were casted in the back of the mirror and many mirrors included the names of eras of China and Wei dynasty (Three States Period) in inscriptions.
The divine beasts (image of a deity and holy animals) were cast on the back and many mirrors included the names of eras of China and the Wei dynasty (Three States Period) in inscriptions.
The divine beasts (image of a deity and holy animals) were cast on the back and many mirrors included the names of eras of China and the Wei dynasty (Three States Period) in inscriptions.

sen.j: なぜ、三角縁とするかの理由については、ほとんどが凸面鏡であり、三角縁にすると構造上作りやすいから、あるいは、神聖な場所を囲む瑞垣をまねた等の説がある。
sen.e: As for the reason of triangular-rim, there are some theories that most of mirrors were convex and it was structurally easier to make in the triangular-rim, or that wooden fences surrounding the holy place were modeled.

As for the reason for the triangular-rim, there are some theories that most of mirrors were convex and it was structurally easier to make them with a triangular-rim, or that wooden fences surrounding a holy place were the model.

As for the reason for the triangular-rim, there are some theories that most of mirrors were convex and it was structurally easier to make them with a triangular-rim, or that wooden fences surrounding a holy place were the model.

sen.j: 中国では2 - 3世紀の時代に、紹興近辺でしか出土しない。
sen.e: In China, they were discovered only near Shaoxing in the second to third century.
In China, they were discovered only near Shaoxing in the second to third century.
In China, they were discovered only near Shaoxing in the second to third century.

sen.j: 三角縁神獣鏡があらわれる前の3世紀前葉には、「神獣鏡」類の画文帯神獣鏡と呼ばれる中国鏡が、約60面出土している。
sen.e: Before the third century when Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror appeared, about 60 Chinese mirrors called Gabuntai Shinjukyo Mirror (Mirror with figures of deities and sacred animals) in the kind of 'mirrors engraving divine beasts.'

Before the third century when the Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror appeared, about sixty Chinese mirrors called Gabuntai Shinjukyo Mirrors (Mirror with figures of deities and sacred animals) in a kind of 'mirror with engravings of divine beasts.'

Before the third century when the Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror appeared, about sixty Chinese mirrors called Gabuntai Shinjukyo Mirrors (Mirror with figures of deities and sacred animals) in a kind of 'mirror with engravings of divine beasts.'

sen.j: その分布の中心は北部九州ではなく畿内地域である。
sen.e: The center of their distribution was Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto), not the northern part of Kyushu region.
The center of their distribution was Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto), not the northern part of Kyushu region.
The center of their distribution was Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto), not the northern part of Kyushu region.

sen.j: なお、三角縁神獣鏡の画像は、画文帯神獣鏡の画像を巧妙に変更して創り上げている。
sen.e: The image of Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was created by artfully changing the image of Gabuntai Shinjukyo Mirror.
The image of the Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was created by artfully changing the image of the Gabuntai Shinjukyo Mirror.
The image of the Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was created by artfully changing the image of the Gabuntai Shinjukyo Mirror.

sen.j: 近年の研究で、鏡の断面が時代とともに変化していることがわかってきた。
sen.e: Recent study shows that the cross-section surface of the mirror changed with times.
Recent studies show that the cross-section surface of the mirror changed with the times.
Recent studies show that the cross-section surface of the mirror changed with the times.

sen.j: 古い鏡は、外区が厚く、それに対して内区が薄いが、時代の経過とともに外区が薄くなり、内区との差がなくなり、終いには内区と外区の厚さが同じになってしまっている。
sen.e: Though older mirrors had thick outer edge and thin inner edge, outer edge was getting thinner to no difference with inner edge with times and finally they became the same thickness.
Though older mirrors had thick outer edges and thin inner edges, the outer edge became thinner while there was no change in the inner edge over time and finally they became the same thickness.
Though older mirrors had thick outer edges and thin inner edges, the outer edge became thinner while there was no change in the inner edge over time and finally they became the same thickness.

sen.j: これらの変化と文様やその配置などを勘案した5段階の型式編年ができあがっている。
sen.e: The chronology of the five-phase type in view of these changes, patterns and arrangements was completed.
The chronology of the five-phase type in view of these changes, patterns and arrangements was completed.
The chronology of the five-phase type in view of these changes, patterns and arrangements was completed.

sen.j: 第1段階は景初3年(239)・正始元年(240)前後と推定できるから、一つの段階を約10年あまりと考えて、第2段階は250年前後、第3段階は260年前後、あとの段階も同様に考える。
sen.e: As the first phase can be guessed to be around 239 or 240, based on about more than 10 year per phase, the second phase is considered to be around 250, the third to be around 260 and the same for later phases.

As the first phase can be guessed to be around 239 or 240, based on about more than ten years per phase, the second phase is considered to be around 250, the third to be around 260 and the same for later phases.

As the first phase can be guessed to be around 239 or 240, based on about more than ten years per phase, the second phase is considered to be around 250, the third to be around 260 and the same for later phases.

sen.j: この型式編年を利用して、出現期古墳はどの段階の鏡を持つかで古墳が年代的に古いかどうかが判断できるようになった。
sen.e: By utilizing this chronology in the type, the phase of the mirror discovered in the tumulus made it possible to judge if the tumulus is chronologically old.
By utilizing this chronology in the type, the phase of the mirror discovered in the tumulus made it possible to judge if the tumulus is chronologically old.
By utilizing this chronology in the type, the phase of the mirror discovered in the tumulus made it possible to judge if the tumulus is chronologically old.

sen.j: ただ、鏡の生産地については難しい議論が進行中である。
sen.e: However, the place of production has been in tough discussion.
However, the place of production has been a tough discussion.
However, the place of production has been a tough discussion.

sen.j: 近年、大阪大学の福永伸哉の研究により、三角縁神獣鏡350面を含む千数百面の鏡の鈕孔（ひも通し孔）の観察から、三角縁神獣鏡の鈕孔の形が長方形で、他の鏡の鈕孔の円形や半円形と異なっていることが分かった。
sen.e: The recent study by Shinya FUKUNAGA of Osaka University in observing bodkins of more than thousand of mirrors including 350 of Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror showed that the shape of bodkin of Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was square and different from that of other mirrors which were round or semicircle.

A recent study by Shinya FUKUNAGA of Osaka University in observing bodkins of more than a thousand of mirrors including 350 of Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror showed that the shape of the bodkin of Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was square and different from that of other mirrors which were round or semicircle.

A recent study by Shinya FUKUNAGA of Osaka University in observing bodkins of more than a thousand of mirrors including 350 of Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror showed that the shape of the bodkin of Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was square and different from that of other mirrors which were round or semicircle.

sen.j: さらに、鏡の鈕孔を長方形に作る癖を持つ、ある中国工人群が三角縁神獣鏡を製作しており、その手法が魏の官営工房に繋がる可能性が強いという。
sen.e: Besides, a group of Chinese craftsmen with mannerism to make bodkins of the mirrors in a square shape made Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror and their skills could be lead to the government-operated crafts in Wei dynasty.

Besides, a group of Chinese craftsmen that made bodkins of the mirrors in a square shape made the Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror and their skills could lead to government-operated crafts in the Wei dynasty.

Besides, a group of Chinese craftsmen that made bodkins of the mirrors in a square shape made the Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror and their skills could lead to government-operated crafts in the Wei dynasty.

sen.j: つまり魏の王朝が卑弥呼や壱与に下賜するために特別に鋳造したのが三角縁神獣鏡であるという新説が提出されている。
sen.e: New theory that it was Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror that Wei dynasty specially casted for giving as an imperial grant to Himiko and Iyo has been submitted.
New theory that it was Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror that Wei dynasty specially casted for presenting as an imperial grant to Himiko and Iyo has been submitted.
New theory that it was Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror that Wei dynasty specially casted for presenting as an imperial grant to Himiko and Iyo has been submitted.

sen.j: 邪馬台国の女王、卑弥呼は魏に遣使していたとされ、中国の歴史書『三国志 (歴史書)』「魏志倭人伝」には239年（景初3年）魏 (三国)の皇帝が卑弥呼に銅鏡百枚を下賜したとする記述があることから、三角縁神獣鏡がその鏡であり、魏、または朝鮮半島の楽浪郡・帯方郡の製作であるとする説がある。
sen.e: Based on the story that the princess of Yamatai-Koku kingdom, Himiko was considered to dispatch to Wei dynasty and on the description in Chinese history book "Sangokushi" (Three Kingdom Saga) (history book) 'Gishiwajinden' (literally, an 'Account of the Wa' in "The History of the Wei Dynasty") that in 239 Emperor of Wei dynasty (Three Kingdom) gave a hundred of bronze mirrors as an imperial grant to Himiko, there is the theory that Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was the said mirror and was produced in Wei dynasty or Rakuro County or Taiho County (ancient counties existed in the northern Korean Peninsula) in the Korean Peninsula.

Based on the story that the princess of Yamatai-Koku kingdom, Himiko was considered to be dispatched to the Wei dynasty and according to a description in the Chinese history book "Sangokushi" (Three Kingdom Saga - history book) 'Gishiwajinden' (literally, an 'Account of the Wa' in "The History of the Wei Dynasty") that in 239 the Emperor of the Wei dynasty (Three Kingdoms) gave a hundred bronze mirrors as an imperial grant to Himiko, there is the theory that Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was the said mirror and it was produced in the Wei dynasty or Rakuro County or Taiho County (ancient counties that existed in the northern Korean Peninsula) in the Korean Peninsula.

Based on the story that the princess of Yamatai-Koku kingdom, Himiko was considered to be dispatched to the Wei dynasty and according to a description in the Chinese history book "Sangokushi" (Three Kingdom Saga - history book) 'Gishiwajinden' (literally, an 'Account of the Wa' in "The History of the Wei Dynasty") that in 239 the Emperor of the Wei dynasty (Three Kingdoms) gave a hundred bronze mirrors as an imperial grant to Himiko, there is the theory that Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was the said mirror and it was produced in the Wei dynasty or Rakuro County or Taiho County (ancient counties that existed in the northern Korean Peninsula) in the Korean Peninsula.

sen.j: 1953年（昭和28年）、京都府山城町 (京都府)（現・木津川市）の椿井大塚山古墳から神獣鏡が出土すると、小林行雄は同型の鏡が日本各地の古墳から出土している事実に着目し、邪馬台国が大和に所在し、のちのヤマト王権が卑弥呼に下賜された神獣鏡を各地の豪族に与えたとする古代政権成立過程を提唱した。
sen.e: When Shinjukyo (the mirror engraving divine beasts) was discovered in Tsubaiotsukayama-kofun Tumulus in Yamashiro-cho, Kyoto Prefecture (Kyoto Prefecture) (currently, Kizugawa City) in 1953, Yukio KOBAYASHI focused on the fact of the same form of mirrors discovered in the various places in Japan and advocated Yamatai-Koku kingdom located in Yamato and the process of the establishment of ancient government that Shinjukyo granted to Himiko by later Yamato sovereignty (the ancient Japan sovereignty) were given to Gozoku (local ruling family) in the various places.

When Shinjukyo (the mirror engraved divine beasts) was discovered in the Tsubaiotsukayama-kofun Tumulus in Yamashiro-cho, Kyoto Prefecture (Kyoto Prefecture) (currently, Kizugawa City) in 1953, Yukio KOBAYASHI focused on the fact that the same form of mirrors were discovered in the various places in Japan and advocated Yamatai-Koku kingdom located in Yamato and the process of the establishment of an ancient government that Shinjukyo granted to Himiko by later Yamato sovereignty (the ancient Japan sovereignty) were given to Gozoku (local ruling family) in the various places.

When Shinjukyo (the mirror engraved divine beasts) was discovered in the Tsubaiotsukayama-kofun Tumulus in Yamashiro-cho, Kyoto Prefecture (Kyoto Prefecture) (currently, Kizugawa City) in 1953, Yukio KOBAYASHI focused on the fact that the same form of mirrors were discovered in the various places in Japan and advocated Yamatai-Koku kingdom located in Yamato and the process of the establishment of an ancient government that Shinjukyo granted to Himiko by later Yamato sovereignty (the ancient Japan sovereignty) were given to Gozoku (local ruling family) in the various places.

sen.j: しかし、同型の鏡の分布からここまでダイナミックな過程を想定するのは無理があるとも言われている。
sen.e: However, some people say that it is impossible to imagine such a dynamic process with the distribution of the same form of mirrors.
However, some people say that it is impossible to imagine such a dynamic process with the distributing the same form of mirrors.
However, some people say that it is impossible to imagine such a dynamic process with the distributing the same form of mirrors.

sen.j: 近年、奈良県黒塚古墳でも三角縁神獣鏡の大量副葬例があり、被葬者にとって三角縁神獣鏡はそれほど珍しくないものであったことが伺われる。
sen.e: Recently, the case of bury of many Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror with a dead person in Kurozuka Tumulus in Nara Prefecture was clarified, which reflected that Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was not so uncommon for the buried people.

Recently, the case of of many Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirrors buried with a dead person in the Kurozuka Tumulus in Nara Prefecture was clarified, which reflected that the Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was not so uncommon amongst buried people.

Recently, the case of many Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirrors buried with a dead person in the Kurozuka Tumulus in Nara Prefecture was clarified, which reflected that the Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was not so uncommon amongst buried people.
sen.cmt: F欄の英文には、of of という表現がありましたので、ｏｆを一つ削除しました。

tit.e: The theory of mirrors made in Japan
The theory of mirrors being made in Japan
The theory of mirrors being made in Japan

sen.j: 一方で、三角縁神獣鏡と同じようなものは中国では出土しておらず、中国で既に改元された年号や実在しない年号の銘が入ったものもあることから、日本製、あるいは中国から渡来した工人の製であるとする説、また、中国製で船で日本に運ばれた舶載鏡とする説、日本で中国の鏡を真似てつくった倣製鏡説などがある。
sen.e: On the other hand, because of the facts that no mirror like Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was discovered in China and that some mirrors had the name of eras already changed in China or nonexistent eras, there are theories that those were made in Japan or produced by the craftsmen coming from China, that those were made in China and loaded in a ship to Japan or that those were modeled on Chinese mirror and produced in Japan.

On the other hand, because of the fact that no mirror similar to the Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was ever discovered in China and that some mirrors had the name of eras already changed in China or had nonexistent eras, there are theories that they were made in Japan or produced by the craftsmen that came from China, or they were made in China and loaded ion a ship destined to Japan or they were modeled on Chinese mirrors and produced in Japan.

On the other hand, because of the fact that no mirror similar to the Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was ever discovered in China and that some mirrors had the name of eras already changed in China or had nonexistent eras, there are theories that they were made in Japan or produced by the craftsmen that came from China, or they were made in China and loaded on a ship destined to Japan or they were modeled on Chinese mirrors and produced in Japan.
sen.cmt: loaded ion を loaded on に修正しました。

tit.j: 三角縁神獣鏡に関する議論
tit.e: Discussion about the Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror
Discussion about the Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror

sen.j: 三角縁神獣鏡が畿内を中心に出土することから、卑弥呼の鏡説をとるのは邪馬台国＝畿内説をとる研究者に多く、日本製説をとるのは邪馬台国＝九州説をとる者に多い。
sen.e: Because Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror were discovered mainly in Kinai region, many researchers advocating Yamatai-Koku kingdom in Kinai region maintain Himiko's mirror and many researchers advocating Yamatai-Koku kingdom in Kyushu region maintain mirrors produced in Japan.

Because Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirrors were discovered mainly in the Kinai region, many researchers advocating the Yamatai-Koku kingdom in the Kinai region maintain Himiko's mirror and many researchers advocating Yamatai-Koku kingdom in Kyushu region maintain the mirrors were produced in Japan.

Because Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirrors were discovered mainly in the Kinai region, many researchers advocating the Yamatai-Koku kingdom in the Kinai region maintain Himiko's mirror and many researchers advocating Yamatai-Koku kingdom in Kyushu region maintain the mirrors were produced in Japan.

sen.j: ただし、日本製説をとる研究者の中にも邪馬台国＝畿内説を主張する者がいる。
sen.e: However, some researchers maintaining mirrors produced in Japan advocate Yamatai-Koku kingdom in Kinai region.
However, some researchers maintaining that the mirrors were produced in Japan advocate Yamatai-Koku kingdom being in the Kinai region.
However, some researchers maintaining that the mirrors were produced in Japan advocate Yamatai-Koku kingdom being in the Kinai region.

sen.j: 彼らの中には、三角縁神獣鏡を、卑弥呼の遣使を記念して呉 (三国)の工人などに日本で作らせたものだと主張する者もいる。
sen.e: Some of them advocate that Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was produced in Japan by craftsmen and others in Wu dynasty (Three Kingdom) in celebration of Himiko's dispatch.
Some of them advocate that the Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was produced in Japan by craftsmen and others in the Wu dynasty (Three Kingdom) in celebration of Himiko's dispatch.
Some of them advocate that the Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was produced in Japan by craftsmen and others in the Wu dynasty (Three Kingdom) in celebration of Himiko's dispatch.

sen.j: 一方邪馬台国＝九州説を主張する研究者は、三角縁神獣鏡全体が（魏の年号が刻まれてはいるが）後世の偽作物であると見なしている。
sen.e: On the other hand, researchers advocating Yamatai-Koku kingdom in Kyushu region consider the whole of Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror to be forged by future generations (though the name of era in Wei dynasty was inscribed on.)

On the other hand, researchers advocating the Yamatai-Koku kingdom in the Kyushu region consider the all Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirrors were be forged by future generations (though the name of era in Wei dynasty was inscribed on them.)

On the other hand, researchers advocating the Yamatai-Koku kingdom in the Kyushu region consider the all Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirrors were be forged by future generations (though the name of era in Wei dynasty was inscribed on them.)

sen.j: 日本製説の研究者からは以下のような疑問点が指摘されているが、卑弥呼の鏡説の研究者からの反論もある。
sen.e: The researchers advocating the mirror produced in Japan point out the following questions while those advocating Himiko's mirror disagree.
Researchers advocating that the mirror was produced in Japan point out the following questions while those advocating Himiko's mirror disagree.
Researchers advocating that the mirror was produced in Japan point out the following questions while those advocating Himiko's mirror disagree.

sen.j: 疑問点
sen.e: Questions
Questions
Questions

sen.j: 三角縁神獣鏡が出土するのは4世紀以降の古墳からのみで、邪馬台国の時代である3世紀の墳墓からは1面も出土しておらず、年代が合わない。
sen.e: It doesn't chronologically match because Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was discovered only in tumulus after the fourth century, never in tombs after the third century which corresponds to the era of Yamatai-Koku kingdom.

It doesn't chronologically match because Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was discovered only in a tumulus after the fourth century, never in tombs after the third century which corresponds to the era of the Yamatai-Koku kingdom.

It doesn't chronologically match because Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was discovered only in a tumulus after the fourth century, never in tombs after the third century which corresponds to the era of the Yamatai-Koku kingdom.

sen.j: 三角縁神獣鏡は中国国内では1面も出土しておらず、中国の鏡ではないと中国の学者が述べている。
sen.e: No Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror has been discovered in China and Chinese scholars say that it is not Chinese.
No Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirrors have been discovered in China and Chinese scholars say that it is not Chinese.
No Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirrors have been discovered in China and Chinese scholars say that it is not Chinese.

sen.j: 改元されて実在しない中国の年号の銘が入った鏡がある。
sen.e: There is the mirror with the inscription of the name of Chinese era which didn't exist after the change of era.
There is the mirror with the inscription of the name of a Chinese era which didn't exist after the change of the era.
There is the mirror with the inscription of the name of a Chinese era which didn't exist after the change of the era.

sen.j: 卑弥呼に下賜された銅鏡は100枚だが、それをはるかに超える数の三角縁神獣鏡が出土している。
sen.e: Though 100 bronze mirrors were given to Himiko as an imperial grant, much more than that of Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror were discovered.
Though 100 bronze mirrors were given to Himiko as an imperial grant, many more Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirrors were discovered.
Though 100 bronze mirrors were given to Himiko as an imperial grant, many more Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirrors were discovered.

sen.j: 反論
sen.e: Counterargument
Counterargument
Counterargument

sen.j: 邪馬台国向けに特別に作らせたものだから中国には残っていない。
sen.e: No Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was left in China because it was specially made for Yamatai-Koku kingdom.
No Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirrors were left in China because it was specially made for theYamatai-Koku kingdom.
No Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirrors were left in China because it was specially made for theYamatai-Koku kingdom.

sen.j: 景初3年は、景初4年正月となるべき月を後十二月とした年であり、その混乱を示すものである。
sen.e: The third year of Keisho was the year when the month to be New Year of the fourth year of Keisho was regarded as after-December, which showed the turmoil.
The third year of Keisho was the year when the month of the New Year of the fourth year of Keisho was regarded as being after December, which showed it was a time of turmoil.
The third year of Keisho (239) was the year when the month of the New Year of the fourth year of Keisho was regarded as being after December, which showed it was a time of turmoil.
sen.cmt: third year of Keisho だけだと、239年との関係が一見不明ですので、付け足しました。

sen.j: 卑弥呼にはその後も何回か銅鏡が下賜された。
sen.e: Later, as well, Himiko was given the bronze mirrors several times.
Later, as well, Himiko was given bronze mirrors several times.
Later, as well, Himiko was given bronze mirrors several times.

sen.j: 三角縁神獣鏡が出土するのは4世紀以降の古墳のみだというが、近年の年輪年代学の成果により、古墳時代の開始は3世紀に繰り上がっており、3世紀に編年される古墳から出土するので、むしろこの鏡が魏時代のものとして矛盾がないことを示している。
sen.e: Against the argument that Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was discovered only in the tumulus after the fourth century, it consistently shows that this mirror was made in Wei dynasty because the beginning of the Tumulus period was moved up to the third century and it was discovered in the tumulus chronologically in the third century due to the recent study results of the chronology in annual rings.

Against the argument that Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was discovered only in tumulus after the fourth century, it consistently shows that this mirror was made in the Wei dynasty because the beginning of the Tumulus period was moved up to the third century and it was discovered in the tumulus chronologically in the third century due to the recent study results of the chronology in annual rings.

Against the argument that Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was discovered only in tumulus after the fourth century, it consistently shows that this mirror was made in the Wei dynasty because the beginning of the Tumulus period was moved up to the third century and it was discovered in the tumulus chronologically in the third century due to the recent study results of the chronology in annual rings.

sen.j: また景初3年、正始元年の銘の鏡もリアルタイムのものとして問題なく理解できる。
sen.e: That the mirrors with inscription of the name in 239 and 240 were also made in those year is understandable without question.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: That mirrors inscribed with 239 and 240 were also made in those years is understandable without question.
That mirrors inscribed with 239 and 240 were also made in those years is understandable without question.

sen.j: 逆にこのような年号を持ちながら、邪馬台国＝九州説論者の主張のようにこの鏡が邪馬台国と無関係とするならば、それこそ不自然である。
sen.e: On the contrary, the theory that this mirror was not related to Yamatai-Koku kingdom despite such name of era as maintained by researchers who advocate Yamatai-Koku kingdom in Kyushu region is rather inconsistent.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On the contrary, the theory that this mirror was not related to the Yamatai-Koku kingdom despite the name of the era as maintained by researchers who advocate Yamatai-Koku kingdom in Kyushu region is rather inconsistent.

On the contrary, the theory that this mirror was not related to the Yamatai-Koku kingdom despite the name of the era as maintained by researchers who advocate Yamatai-Koku kingdom in Kyushu region is rather inconsistent.

sen.j: 魏の鏡であるか、それとも日本製なのかについては、どちらの説にも決定的な証拠はないが、近年定説化しつつある年代観からすれば景初三年銘、正始元年銘の三角縁神獣鏡自体は紀年にあるとおり3世紀の鏡として理解できるため、邪馬台国大和説の有力な根拠のひとつとなっている。
sen.e: Though there is no crucial evidence to determine whether Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was made in Wei dynasty or in Japan, it is the one of compelling evidences of Yamato theory of Yamatai-Koku kingdom because the mirror with inscription of name of the year 239 and 240 can be considered to the mirror in the third century as seen in the counting years according to the accepted view of chronology in recent years.

Though there is no crucial evidence to determine whether the Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was made in the Wei dynasty or in Japan, it is one of the compelling evidences of the Yamato theory of the Yamatai-Koku kingdom because the mirror inscribed with the years 239 and 240 can be considered to be mirrors from the third century as seen when counting years according to the accepted view of chronology in recent years.

Though there is no crucial evidence to determine whether the Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror was made in the Wei dynasty or in Japan, it is one of the compelling evidences of the Yamato theory of the Yamatai-Koku kingdom because the mirror inscribed with the years 239 and 240 can be considered to be mirrors from the third century as seen when counting years according to the accepted view of chronology in recent years.

sen.j: 鏡を作った者が、何らかの理由で魏の年号を使いたかったことにはほぼ間違いがない。
sen.e: There is little doubt that the person who made the mirror wanted to use the name of Wei for some reason.
There is little doubt that the person who made the mirror wanted to use the name of Wei for some reason.
There is little doubt that the person who made the mirror wanted to use the name of Wei for some reason.

tit.j: 紀年銘をもつ三角縁神獣鏡
tit.e: Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror with the inscription of counting years
Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror inscribed with counted years
Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror inscribed with counted years

sen.j: 三角縁神獣鏡の銘文中に紀年が記された四面の鏡がある。
sen.e: Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror has tetrahedral mirrors with the counting year on the inscription.
The Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror has tetrahedral mirrors with the counted years inscribed.
The Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror has tetrahedral mirrors with the counted years inscribed.

sen.j: 島根県雲南市加茂町大字神原・神原神社古墳出土の「景初三年」鏡、群馬県高崎市柴崎町蟹沢・蟹沢古墳、兵庫県豊岡市森尾字市尾・森尾古墳、山口県周南市（旧新南陽市）竹島御家老屋敷古墳の三古墳から出土した同型の「正始 (魏)元年」鏡三面である。
sen.e: They are three mirrors, 'Keisho sannen' (the third year of Keisho) mirror discovered in Kanbara-jinja Shrine kofun Tumulus in oaza (an administrative unit) Kanbara, Kamo-cho, Unnan City, Shimane Prefecture, the same form of 'Seishi (Wei) gannen' (the first year of Seishi) mirrors discovered in Kanizawa-kofun Tumulus in Kanizawa, Shibasaki-machi, Takasaki City, Gunma Prefecture, Morio-kofun Tumulus in aza Ichio, Morio, Toyooka City, Hyogo Prefecture and in Gokaroyashiki-kofun Tumulus in Takeshima Island, Shunan City (the former, Shinnanyo City), Yamaguchi Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 「兵庫県豊岡市森尾字市尾」の「字市尾」については読み未確認
sen.e: There are three mirrors, 'Keisho sannen' (the third year of Keisho) mirror discovered in Kanbara-jinja Shrine kofun Tumulus in oaza (an administrative unit) Kanbara, Kamo-cho, Unnan City, Shimane Prefecture, the same form of 'Seishi (Wei) gannen' (the first year of Seishi) mirrors discovered in Kanizawa-kofun Tumulus in Kanizawa, Shibasaki-machi, Takasaki City, Gunma Prefecture, Morio-kofun Tumulus in aza Ichio, Morio, Toyooka City, Hyogo Prefecture and in Gokaroyashiki-kofun Tumulus in Takeshima Island, Shunan City (the former, Shinnanyo City), Yamaguchi Prefecture.

There are three mirrors, 'Keisho sannen' (the third year of Keisho) mirror discovered in Kanbara-jinja Shrine kofun Tumulus in oaza (an administrative unit) Kanbara, Kamo-cho, Unnan City, Shimane Prefecture, the same form of 'Seishi (Wei) gannen' (the first year of Seishi) mirrors discovered in Kanizawa-kofun Tumulus in Kanizawa, Shibasaki-machi, Takasaki City, Gunma Prefecture, Morio-kofun Tumulus in aza Ichio, Morio, Toyooka City, Hyogo Prefecture and in Gokaroyashiki-kofun Tumulus in Takeshima Island, Shunan City (the former, Shinnanyo City), Yamaguchi Prefecture.

sen.j: これらの鏡四面は、すべて文様の神像と獣形像が同じ方向に並ぶ同向式である。
sen.e: These four mirrors are the ones whose images of deities and breasts in patterns were all set in the same direction.
These mirrors have images of deities and breasts in patterns all set in the same direction.
These mirrors have images of deities and breasts in patterns all set in the same direction.

sen.j: 「景初三年」鏡
sen.e: Keisho sannen' mirror
Keisho sannen' mirror
Keisho sannen' mirror

sen.j: 景初三年陳是作鏡自有経述本是京師杜□□出吏人□□□（位）□（至）三公母人？之保子宜孫寿如金石
sen.cmt: 意味解釈が困難なため訳出できませんでした
sen.e: In 239, Ching has made this mirror. Here is my history. I used to live in Yangzhou of Wu in China as a mirror maker but now I am in exile living in the end of the land. (After this sentence it is hard to comprehend because of the partly corrupted characters) May your life be long like a golden stone and may your flesh and blood be prosperous.''
sen.cmt: 後半部分は、一部意味解釈が困難なため訳出できませんでした。銘文ですので括弧に入れました。

sen.j: 「正始元年」鏡
sen.e: Seishi gannen' mirror
Seishi gannen' mirror
Seishi gannen' mirror

sen.j: □始元年陳是作鏡自有経述本自州師杜地命出寿如金石保子宜孫
sen.cmt: 意味解釈が困難なため訳出できませんでした
sen.e: In 240, Ching has made this mirror. Here is my history. I used to live in Yangzhou of Wu in China as a mirror maker but now I am in exile living in the end of the land. May your life be long like a golden stone and may your flesh and blood be prosperous.'
sen.cmt: 意味を翻訳しましたが、正しいかどうかは不明です。

sen.j: 三角縁神獣鏡の出土を府県別にみると京都府が50枚以上、次いで奈良県の44枚が群を抜いており、福岡県、大阪府が30枚台である。
sen.e: The discovery of Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror by prefectures is more than 50 in Kyoto Prefecture and 44 in Nara Prefecture, which are outstanding, followed by 30s in Fukuoka and Osaka Prefectures.

The discovery of Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirrors by prefecture amount to more than fifty in Kyoto Prefecture and fourty-four in Nara Prefecture, which are outstanding, followed by thirty or more in Fukuoka and Osaka Prefectures.

The discovery of Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirrors by prefecture amount to more than fifty in Kyoto Prefecture and fourty-four in Nara Prefecture, which are outstanding, followed by thirty or more in Fukuoka and Osaka Prefectures.

sen.j: このことから、奈良を中心とする近畿地方（奈良・大阪・京都）に三角縁神獣鏡の出土が多いことがわかる。
sen.e: This shows that many Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirror were discovered in Kinki region (Nara, Osaka and Kyoto Prefectures) centering on Nara Prefecture.
This shows that many Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirrors were discovered in the Kinki region (Nara, Osaka, and Kyoto Prefectures) centering on Nara Prefecture.
This shows that many Sankakubuchi Shinjukyo Mirrors were discovered in the Kinki region (Nara, Osaka, and Kyoto Prefectures) centering on Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: さらに、近畿地方での出土数は170枚を超え、全体の二分の一以上を占めている。
sen.e: Besides, more than 170 were discovered in Kinki region, which accounts for more than half of the total.
Besides, more than 170 were discovered in the Kinki region, accounting for more than half of the total.
Besides, more than 170 were discovered in the Kinki region, accounting for more than half of the total.
